title: An Improved Affine Equivalence Algorithm for Random Permutations.
abstract: In this paper we study the affine equivalence problem, where given two functions \(\varvec{F},\varvec{G}: \{0,1\}^n \rightarrow \{0,1\}^n\), the goal is to determine whether there exist invertible affine transformations \(A_1,A_2\) over \(GF(2)^n\) such that \(\varvec{G} = A_2 \circ \varvec{F} \circ A_1\). Algorithms for this problem have several well-known applications in the design and analysis of Sboxes, cryptanalysis of white-box ciphers and breaking a generalized Even-Mansour scheme.
